t: Matthew 9
The Son of Man Forgives and Heals
So*p he got into a boat, crossed over, and came to his own town.
Just then some men brought to him a paralytic lying on a stretcher. Seeing their faith, Jesus told the paralytic, “Have*r courage,*r son,*r your*r sins*r are*r forgiven.”*r
At*p this, some of the scribes said to themselves, “He’s blaspheming!”
Perceiving*p their thoughts, Jesus said, “Why*r are*r you*r thinking*r evil*r things*r in*r your*r hearts?*r
For*r which*r is*r easier:*r to*r say,*r ‘Your*r sins*r are*r forgiven,’*r or*r to*r say,*r ‘Get*r up*r and*r walk’?*r

But*r so*r that*r you*r may*r know*r that*r the*r Son*r of*r Man*r has*r authority*r on*r earth*r to*r forgive*r sins”-*r then he told the paralytic, “Get*r up,*r take*r your*r stretcher,*r and*r go*r home.”*r
So he got up and went home.
When the crowds saw this, they were awestruck and gave glory to God, who had given such authority to men.
The Call of Matthew
As*p Jesus went on from there, he saw a man named Matthew sitting at the tax office, and he said to him, “Follow*r me,”*r and he got up and followed him.
While*p he was reclining at the table in the house, many tax collectors and sinners came to eat with Jesus and his disciples.
When the Pharisees saw this, they asked his disciples, “Why does your teacher eat with tax collectors and sinners?”
Now*p when he heard this, he said, “It*r is*r not*r those*r who*r are*r well*r who*r need*r a*r doctor,*r but*r those*r who*r are*r sick.*r
Go*r and*r learn*r what*r this*r means:*r I*ir desire*ir mercy*ir and*ir not*ir sacrifice.*ir For*r I*r didn’t*r come*r to*r call*r the*r righteous,*r but*r sinners.”*r
A Question about Fasting
Then*p John’s disciples came to him, saying, “Why do we and the Pharisees fast often, but your disciples do not fast?”

Jesus*p said to them, “Can*r the*r wedding*r guests*r be*r sad*r while*r the*r groom*r is*r with*r them?*r The*r time*r will*r come*r when*r the*r groom*r will*r be*r taken*r away*r from*r them,*r and*r then*r they*r will*r fast.*r
No*r one*r patches*r an*r old*r garment*r with*r unshrunk*r cloth,*r because*r the*r patch*r pulls*r away*r from*r the*r garment*r and*r makes*r the*r tear*r worse.*r

And*r no*r one*r puts*r new*r wine*r into*r old*r wineskins.*r Otherwise,*r the*r skins*r burst,*r the*r wine*r spills*r out,*r and*r the*r skins*r are*r ruined.*r No,*r they*r put*r new*r wine*r into*r fresh*r wineskins,*r and*r both*r are*r preserved.”*r
A Girl Restored and a Woman Healed
As*p he was telling them these things, suddenly one of the leaders came and knelt down before him, saying, “My daughter just died, but come and lay your hand on her, and she will live.”
So Jesus and his disciples got up and followed him.
Just*p then, a woman who had suffered from bleeding for twelve years approached from behind and touched the end of his robe,
for she said to herself, “If I can just touch his robe, I’ll be made well.”
Jesus*p turned and saw her. “Have*r courage,*r daughter,”*r he said. “Your*r faith*r has*r saved*r you.”*r And the woman was made well from that moment.
When*p Jesus came to the leader’s house, he saw the flute players and a crowd lamenting loudly.
“Leave,”*r he said, “because*r the*r girl*r is*r not*r dead*r but*r asleep.”*r And they laughed at him.
After the crowd had been put outside, he went in and took her by the hand, and the girl got up.
Then news of this spread throughout that whole area.
Healing the Blind
As*p Jesus went on from there, two blind men followed him, calling out, “Have mercy on us, Son of David!”
When*p he entered the house, the blind men approached him, and Jesus said to them, “Do*r you*r believe*r that*r I*r can*r do*r this?”*r They*p said to him, “Yes, Lord.”
Then*p he touched their eyes, saying, “Let*r it*r be*r done*r for*r you*r according*r to*r your*r faith.”*r
And their eyes were opened. Then Jesus warned them sternly, “Be*r sure*r that*r no*r one*r finds*r out.”*r
But they went out and spread the news about him throughout that whole area.
Driving Out a Demon
Just*p as they were going out, a demon-possessed man who was unable to speak was brought to him.
When the demon had been driven out, the man who had been mute spoke, and the crowds were amazed, saying, “Nothing like this has ever been seen in Israel!”
But*p the Pharisees said, “He drives out demons by the ruler of the demons.”
The Lord of the Harvest
Jesus*p continued going around to all the towns and villages, teaching in their synagogues, preaching the good news of the kingdom, and healing every disease and every sickness.
When he saw the crowds, he felt compassion for them, because they were distressed and dejected, like sheep without a shepherd.
Then he said to his disciples, “The*r harvest*r is*r abundant,*r but*r the*r workers*r are*r few.*r
Therefore,*r pray*r to*r the*r Lord*r of*r the*r harvest*r to*r send*r out*r workers*r into*r his*r harvest.”*r
